intro: Trichanthecium cyanescens, commonly known as the blue-green spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers and hairy stems. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a rough texture. Trichanthecium cyanescens is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
